statements.name: PROC GAMSELECT
statements.description: fits and performs model selection for generalized additive models
statements.help:
PROC GAMSELECT <options>;                 
	BY  variables;                 
	CLASS  variable <(options)>...<variable <(options)>></ global-options>;                 
	DISPLAY <table-list></ options>;                 
	DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	MODEL  response <(response-options)> = <PARAM(effects)><SPLINE(variable </ spline-options>)><SPLINE(variable1 variable2 </ spline-options>)></ model-options>;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=libref.data-table <COMPONENT><COMPVARS=(variables)><COPYVARS=(variables)><keyword <=name>>...<keyword <=name>>;                 
	PARTITION  partition-option;                 
	SELECTION <METHOD=method<(method-options)>>;                 
	STORE <OUT=>libref.data-table;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC GAMSELECT to use

arguments.name: ITDETAILS
arguments.description: generates the "Iteration Details" table

arguments.name: NOCLPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the "Class Level Information" table if you do not specify number. If you specify number, the values of the classification variables are displayed for only those variables whose number of levels is less than number.

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: {OtherOptions}[global-plot-option] [label=plot_unpack]{UNPACK} suppresses paneling

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all default plots

arguments.name: COMPONENTS
arguments.description: option to request that the smoothing component plots, except for bivariate contour plots, use a common vertical axis

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all plots

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies an integer to use to start the pseudorandom number generator for subset sampling from observations to form knots if necessary, for random cross validation if the boosting method is used for model selection, and for random data partitioning if a separate random number seed is not supplied

arguments.name: SINGCHOL=
arguments.description: tunes the singularity criterion in Cholesky decomposition and matrix inversion operations

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: tunes the singularity criterion that is used to solve ridge regressions in searching upper bounds of the sparsity parameter and the smoothness parameter, if you specify the shrinkage method of model selection

statements.name: BY
statements.description: produces separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: names the classification variables to be used as explanatory variables in the analysis

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Reverses the sort order

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Treats missing values as valid levels

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the sort order for the levels

arguments.name: PARAM=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameterization of the variable

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: Specifies the reference level of the variable

statements.name: DISPLAY
statements.description: enables you to specify a list of display tables to display or exclude

arguments.name: CASESENSITIVE
arguments.description: performs a case-sensitive comparison of table names in the table-list to display table names when tables are subsetted for display

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: displays all display tables except those that you specify in the table-list

arguments.name: EXCLUDEALL
arguments.description: suppresses display of all tables

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: displays the display table names, labels, and paths

statements.name: DISPLAYOUT
statements.description: enables you to create output tables from your displayed output
statements.help: DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                                              *table-spec-list* specifies a list of output tables in key=value or key format                     *key=value* specifies *key* as the ODS table name, path, or partial pathname, and *value* as the output table name                     *key* is the ODS table name and the output table name

arguments.name: INCLUDEALL
arguments.description: creates output tables for all display tables

arguments.name: NOREPLACE
arguments.description: does not replace any existing output table of the same name

arguments.name: REPEATED
arguments.description: replicates all output tables on all nodes

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: MODEL
statements.description: specifies the response (dependent or target) variable and the predictor (independent or explanatory) effects of the model

arguments.name: ALLOBS
arguments.description: uses values of spline variables from all data roles for constructing the spline basis functions. By default, only observations that have the training data role are used to construct the spline basis functions.

arguments.name: DISPERSION=
arguments.description: specifies a fixed dispersion parameter for distributions that have a dispersion parameter

arguments.name: DISTRIBUTION=
arguments.description: specifies the response distribution for the model

arguments.name: BINARY
arguments.description: specifies a binary response distribution

arguments.name: BINOMIAL
arguments.description: specifies a binomial response distribution

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: specifies a gamma response distribution

arguments.name: INVGAUSS
arguments.description: specifies an inverse Gaussian response distribution

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: specifies a normal response distribution

arguments.name: POISSON
arguments.description: specifies a Poisson response distribution

arguments.name: INITIALPHI=
arguments.description: specifies a starting value for iterative maximum likelihood estimation of the dispersion parameter for distributions that have a dispersion parameter

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies the link function for the model

arguments.name: IDENTITY
arguments.description: specifies an identity link function

arguments.name: LOGIT
arguments.description: specifies a logit link function

arguments.name: PROBIT
arguments.description: specifies a probit link function

arguments.name: CLOGCLOG
arguments.description: specifies a complementary log-log link function

arguments.name: LOGLOG
arguments.description: specifies a log-log link function

arguments.name: INV
arguments.description: specifies a reciprocal link function

arguments.name: INV2
arguments.description: specifies a reciprocal square link function

arguments.name: MAXPHI=
arguments.description: specifies an upper bound for maximum likelihood estimation of the dispersion parameter for distributions that have a dispersion parameter

arguments.name: MINPHI=
arguments.description: specifies a lower bound for maximum likelihood estimation of the dispersion parameter for distributions that have a dispersion parameter

arguments.name: OFFSET=
arguments.description: specifies a variable to use as an offset to the linear predictor

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the order of the response categories

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the event category for the binary response model

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of the response variable

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: specifies the reference category for the binary response model

arguments.name: PARAM
arguments.description: specifies parametric effects that are constructed from variables in the input data; this option can appear multiple times

arguments.name: SPLINE
arguments.description: defines one univariate spline effect

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of the spline transformation, where number must be a nonnegative integer. This option is not applicable when the shrinkage method is requested.

arguments.name: DETAILS
arguments.description: produces a detailed spline specification information table

arguments.name: DF=
arguments.description: specifies the fixed degrees of freedom for the spline at each boosting iteration. This option is applicable only when the boosting selection method is requested.

arguments.name: DIFFORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order of the difference penalty for a B-spline. This option is applicable only when the boosting selection method is requested.

arguments.name: KNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the method to use for supplying user-defined knot values for constructing basis expansions

arguments.name: EQUAL
arguments.description: specifies the number of equally spaced interior knots to use for every variable in a spline term

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: specifies a list of values as knots for the spline construction

arguments.name: LOWEREXKNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the lower exterior knots

arguments.name: MAXKNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of knots if data points are used to form knots. The boosting method does not support knot construction from unique data points.

arguments.name: SMOOTH=
arguments.description: specifies a fixed smoothing parameter. This option is applicable only when the boosting selection method is requested.

arguments.name: UPPEREXKNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the upper exterior knots

arguments.name: WEIGHT1=
arguments.description: specifies a sparsity penalty strength parameter. When you specify this option, a spline term might receive more or less sparsity penalty than other terms. This option is applicable only when the shrinkage selection method is requested.

arguments.name: WEIGHT2=
arguments.description: specifies a smoothness penalty strength parameter. When you specify this option, a spline term might receive more or less smoothness penalty than other terms. This option is applicable only when the shrinkage selection method is requested.

arguments.name: SPLINE
arguments.description: defines one bivariate spline effect. This option is applicable only when the shrinkage selection method is requested.

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of the spline transformation, where number must be a nonnegative integer. This option is not applicable when the shrinkage method is requested.

arguments.name: DETAILS
arguments.description: produces a detailed spline specification information table

arguments.name: DF=
arguments.description: specifies the fixed degrees of freedom for the spline at each boosting iteration. This option is applicable only when the boosting selection method is requested.

arguments.name: DIFFORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order of the difference penalty for a B-spline. This option is applicable only when the boosting selection method is requested.

arguments.name: KNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the method to use for supplying user-defined knot values for constructing basis expansions

arguments.name: EQUAL
arguments.description: specifies the number of equally spaced interior knots to use for every variable in a spline term

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: specifies a list of values as knots for the spline construction. For a multivariate spline term, the listed values are taken as multiple row vectors, where each vector has values that are ordered by specified variables.

arguments.name: LOWEREXKNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the lower exterior knots

arguments.name: SMOOTH=
arguments.description: specifies a fixed smoothing parameter. This option is applicable only when the boosting selection method is requested.

arguments.name: UPPEREXKNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the upper exterior knots

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates a data table that contains observationwise statistics that PROC GAMSELECT computes after fitting the model

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC GAMSELECT to use

arguments.name: COMPONENT
arguments.description: produces componentwise statistics for all spline terms if LINP is specified as a keyword

arguments.name: COMPVAR
arguments.description: transfers one or more variables that are computed from programming statements to the output data table

arguments.name: COPYVAR=
arguments.description: transfers one or more variables from the input data table to the output data table

arguments.name: XBETA
arguments.description: requests the linear predictor

arguments.name: PEARSON
arguments.description: computes the Pearson residual

arguments.name: PRED
arguments.description: computes predicted values for the response variable

arguments.name: RESIDUAL
arguments.description: computes the raw residual

arguments.name: ROLE
arguments.description: specifies the numeric variable that indicates the role played by each observation in fitting the model

statements.name: PARTITION
statements.description: specifies how observations in the input data set are logically partitioned into disjoint subsets for model training, validation, and testing

arguments.name: FRACTION
arguments.description: randomly assigns specified proportions of the observations in the input data table to the roles

arguments.name: ROLE=
arguments.description: names the variable in the input data table whose values are used to assign roles to each observation

statements.name: SELECTION
statements.description: performs model selection by examining whether spline effects should be kept in the model

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method to use to select the model

arguments.name: BOOSTING
arguments.description: specifies the boosting method

arguments.name: CHOOSE=
arguments.description: specifies the criterion to use to select the final model

arguments.name: CV
arguments.description: specifies k-fold cross validation of the average square error

arguments.name: VALIDATE
arguments.description: specifies the average square error for the validation data

arguments.name: INDEX=
arguments.description: names the variable in the input data table whose values are used to assign observations to partition folds for cross validation. This option is applicable only if you specify the CHOOSE=CV option.

arguments.name: KFOLD=
arguments.description: specifies the number of partition folds in the random cross validation process. This option is applicable only if you specify the CHOOSE=CV option.

arguments.name: LINPINMEM=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of observations for which the linear predictor values are stored in memory when you are training the model

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations for the boosting method

arguments.name: STEPSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the step size to use for the boosting algorithm, where number must be between 0 and 1

arguments.name: STOPHORIZON=
arguments.description: specifies the number of consecutive iterations in which the performance measured by the criterion that you specify in the CHOOSE= option must deteriorate in order to terminate the selection process.

arguments.name: STOPTOL=
arguments.description: specifies the number to use as the tolerance for evaluating the relative change in the CHOOSE= option

arguments.name: SHRINKAGE
arguments.description: specifies the shrinkage method

arguments.name: ADMMABSEPS=
arguments.description: specifies the absolute convergence criterion for the alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM) algorithm that is used to compute the solution

arguments.name: ADMMMAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations that the ADMM algorithm can take at each step of solving a reweighted additive model

arguments.name: ADMMRELEPS=
arguments.description: specifies the relative convergence criterion for the ADMM algorithm that is used to compute the solution

arguments.name: ADMMRHO=
arguments.description: specifies the tuning parameter to use in the ADMM algorithm to control the balance between the primal residual and the dual residual

arguments.name: ADMMRHOADAPTIVE
arguments.description: specifies whether to use an adaptive mechanism to update the ADMM tuning parameter in the first several steps

arguments.name: DISTRIBUTEDSEARCH
arguments.description: specifies whether to use distributed mode to evaluate different regularization parameter candidates in a grid environment

arguments.name: LAMBDA1=
arguments.description: sets a fixed nonnegative value to control the sparsity penalty

arguments.name: LAMBDA2=
arguments.description: sets a fixed nonnegative value to control the smoothness penalty

arguments.name: LAMBDA3=
arguments.description: sets a fixed nonnegative value to control the generalized ridge penalty

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations that generalized additive model fitting can take by solving reweighted additive models at each iteration

arguments.name: MAXLAMBDA1=
arguments.description: sets the maximum value to start with to search the optimal sparsity penalty parameter

arguments.name: MAXLAMBDA2=
arguments.description: sets the maximum value to start with to search the optimal smoothness penalty parameter

arguments.name: MAXLAMBDA3=
arguments.description: sets the maximum value to start with to search the optimal generalized ridge penalty parameter

arguments.name: NUMLAMBDA1=
arguments.description: sets the total number of candidates to try in searching the optimal sparsity penalty parameter

arguments.name: NUMLAMBDA2=
arguments.description: sets the total number of candidates to try in searching the optimal smoothness penalty parameter

arguments.name: NUMLAMBDA3=
arguments.description: sets the total number of candidates to try in searching the optimal generalized ridge parameter

arguments.name: RHOLAMBDA1=
arguments.description: sets the scaling factor for the sparsity penalty parameter when computing a new candidate from its previous candidate attempt

arguments.name: RHOLAMBDA2=
arguments.description: sets the scaling factor for the smoothness penalty parameter when computing a new candidate from its previous candidate attempt

arguments.name: RHOLAMBDA3=
arguments.description: sets the scaling factor for the generalized ridge penalty parameter when computing a new candidate from its previous candidate attempt

statements.name: STORE
statements.description: saves the context and results of the statistical analysis.
